docs.snippet: LEAD:    TENNIS       Sabatini and Capriati Gain    Gabriela Sabatini and Jennifer Capriati led nine of the top 10 seeded players to victory at the Player's Challenge championships yesterday in Montreal. But second-round play was also marked by three...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: TENNIS Sabatini and Capriati Gain Gabriela Sabatini and Jennifer Capriati led nine of the top 10 seeded players to victory at the Player's Challenge championships yesterday in Montreal. But second-round play was also marked by three retirements and one default because of injuries.

headline.main: Farm Policy's Problem Is Subsidies for Few

docs.snippet: LEAD: Excited by stories of a mountain of silver, the colonizing Spanish in the early 16th century gave the name Rio de la Plata - River of Silver - to the great South American river system that ends at Buenos Aires. In the Andes, along the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Excited by stories of a mountain of silver, the colonizing Spanish in the early 16th century gave the name Rio de la Plata - River of Silver - to the great South American river system that ends at Buenos Aires. In the Andes, along the continent's western rim, their dreams would be fulfilled. So abundant was the supply of the glittering metal that in the 17th century, in Potosi alone - now part of Bolivia - more than 3,000 mine shafts were opened.

byline.original: By Cristina Carlisle; Cristina Carlisle is on staff at The Times bureau in Buenos Aires

docs.snippet: LEAD: With elections two months away, Brazil's Government is wrestling with violent strikes, a sharp recession and threats by foreign creditors.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The six-month-old Government of President Luis Alberto Lacalle has joined the trend in South America toward reducing the state's role in the economy, but tough labor opposition means that each step will be hard fought.

docs.snippet: LEAD: While Uruguay's national Government tries to push the country down the capitalist path, the popular Mayor of Montevideo is governing on a platform typical of the socialist world - before that world was turned upside down.

headline.main: In Uruguay, Two Leaders and Two Ideologies

docs.snippet: LEAD: A disarming quiet pervades the docks here each morning, but the stillness is misleading. Anxious yachtsmen are up at dawn preparing to race round the world in the BOC Challenge. They are moving with purpose through the innards of their boats....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A disarming quiet pervades the docks here each morning, but the stillness is misleading. Anxious yachtsmen are up at dawn preparing to race round the world in the BOC Challenge. They are moving with purpose through the innards of their boats. In two weeks, these sailors - for the first time, both men and women - will be setting sail in a competition that has no mercy for the unprepared.

byline.original: By BARBARA LLOYD, Special to The New York Times
